name: Eisenhower Matrix
description: A method that helps you prioritize tasks based on urgency and importance, so you focus on what really matters.
howToUse: Sort your tasks into four quadrants: urgent & important, important but not urgent, urgent but not important, and neither. Focus on the top-left, schedule the top-right, delegate the bottom-left, and discard the bottom-right.

name: Eat the Frog
description: A technique that encourages you to tackle your most difficult or important task first thing in the day.
howToUse: Write down your tasks and pick the most important or dreaded one — your 'frog'. Complete it first before moving on to anything else.

name: Pomodoro Technique
description: A time management method that breaks your work into focused intervals, traditionally 25 minutes long, separated by short breaks.
howToUse: Choose a task, set a 25-minute timer, and work with full focus. When the timer ends, take a 5-minute break. After four sessions, take a longer break.

name: Ivy Lee Method
description: A simple planning technique that helps you organize and complete your most important tasks each day.
howToUse: At the end of your day, write down the six most important tasks for tomorrow. Prioritize them. The next day, focus on the first task until it’s done, then move on.

name: Time Blocking
description: A productivity strategy where you divide your day into blocks of time and assign specific tasks to each block.
howToUse: Create a visual calendar or grid. Assign specific tasks or task types to each time slot. Stick to your schedule as if each block is an appointment.
